title: MobiRides Launches Revolutionary Car Sharing Platform in Botswana
subtitle: First-of-its-kind service brings affordable, sustainable transportation to major cities across the country
excerpt: MobiRides today announced the official launch of its innovative car sharing platform, making it the first comprehensive peer-to-peer vehicle sharing service in Botswana.
content:
GABORONE, Botswana - January 15, 2024 - MobiRides, Botswana's pioneering car sharing platform, today announced its official launch, bringing a revolutionary transportation solution to cities across the country. The platform connects car owners with users who need temporary access to vehicles, creating a sustainable and affordable alternative to traditional car rental and ownership.

Founded by local entrepreneurs with deep understanding of Botswana's transportation challenges, MobiRides addresses the growing need for flexible mobility solutions in urban areas. The platform launches with over 500 registered vehicles across Gaborone, Francistown, and Maun, with plans to expand to additional cities throughout 2024.

'We're excited to bring this innovative solution to Botswana,' said Thabo Mogale, CEO and Co-founder of MobiRides. 'Our platform not only provides convenient access to vehicles for users but also creates new income opportunities for car owners across the country.'

The MobiRides platform features comprehensive insurance coverage, 24/7 customer support, and a user-friendly mobile application available for both iOS and Android devices. All vehicles undergo thorough safety inspections, and users are verified through a robust screening process.

Key features of the MobiRides platform include:
- Instant booking through mobile app
- Comprehensive insurance coverage
- 24/7 roadside assistance
- Flexible rental periods from hourly to monthly
- Contactless pickup and return
- Real-time vehicle tracking

The launch comes at a time when Botswana is experiencing rapid urbanization and growing demand for flexible transportation options. MobiRides' solution addresses environmental concerns by maximizing vehicle utilization and reducing the need for individual car ownership.

'This is more than just a car sharing service,' added Keitumetse Seretse, CTO of MobiRides. 'We're building a community-driven platform that promotes sustainable transportation while supporting local economic growth.'

MobiRides is now available for download on the App Store and Google Play Store. New users can sign up with a special launch promotion offering 50% off their first rental.
author: MobiRides Communications Team

title: MobiRides Secures $2M Seed Funding to Expand Across Southern Africa
subtitle: Investment will fuel expansion into Namibia and Zambia, enhance technology platform
excerpt: MobiRides announced today that it has secured $2 million in seed funding from leading African venture capital firms to accelerate its expansion across Southern Africa.
content:
GABORONE, Botswana - January 8, 2024 - MobiRides, the leading car sharing platform in Botswana, today announced the successful completion of its $2 million seed funding round. The investment was led by African venture capital firm Savanna Fund, with participation from local investors and international mobility-focused funds.

The funding will be used to accelerate MobiRides' expansion into Namibia and Zambia, enhance its technology platform, and grow its team across the region. The company plans to launch operations in Windhoek and Lusaka by the end of 2024.

'This investment validates our vision of creating a comprehensive mobility ecosystem across Southern Africa,' said Thabo Mogale, CEO of MobiRides. 'We're excited to work with investors who understand the unique opportunities and challenges in the African market.'

Since its launch six months ago, MobiRides has achieved significant milestones:
- Over 10,000 registered users
- 500+ vehicles on the platform
- 95% customer satisfaction rating
- Presence in three major Botswana cities
- Zero major safety incidents

The platform has processed over 25,000 bookings and generated more than $500,000 in revenue for vehicle owners across Botswana. The average car owner on the platform earns an additional $800 per month.

'MobiRides has demonstrated exceptional growth and market fit in Botswana,' said Sarah Johnson, Partner at Savanna Fund. 'Their technology-first approach and deep understanding of local markets make them well-positioned to become the leading mobility platform in Southern Africa.'

The funding round also included strategic investors from the automotive and insurance industries, bringing valuable partnerships and expertise to support MobiRides' growth.

MobiRides plans to use the investment to:
- Expand to Namibia and Zambia by Q4 2024
- Enhance mobile app features and user experience
- Implement advanced telematics and IoT solutions
- Grow engineering and operations teams
- Develop partnerships with local automotive dealers

'We're building more than just a car sharing platform,' added Keitumetse Seretse, CTO of MobiRides. 'Our vision is to create a comprehensive mobility ecosystem that includes car sharing, ride-hailing, and eventually autonomous vehicles.'

The company is also exploring opportunities in electric vehicle integration and has signed preliminary agreements with several EV manufacturers to introduce electric vehicles to its platform in 2025.
author: MobiRides Communications Team

title: MobiRides Partners with Local Insurance Companies to Enhance Coverage
subtitle: New partnerships provide comprehensive protection for all platform users
excerpt: MobiRides announced strategic partnerships with leading Botswana insurance companies to provide enhanced coverage and protection for all users of its car sharing platform.
content:
GABORONE, Botswana - December 20, 2023 - MobiRides today announced strategic partnerships with Botswana Insurance Company (BIC) and Metropolitan Life Botswana to provide comprehensive insurance coverage for all users of its car sharing platform.

The partnerships ensure that both car owners and renters are fully protected during every trip, with coverage that exceeds traditional car rental insurance. The enhanced insurance package includes liability coverage, comprehensive vehicle protection, and personal accident insurance.

'Safety and security are our top priorities,' said Mpho Kgosana, Head of Operations at MobiRides. 'These partnerships with trusted local insurers give our users peace of mind and demonstrate our commitment to responsible car sharing.'

Key features of the enhanced insurance coverage include:
- Up to P2 million in liability coverage
- Comprehensive vehicle damage protection
- Personal accident insurance for drivers and passengers
- 24/7 claims support in English and Setswana
- Roadside assistance across Botswana
- Coverage for theft and vandalism

The insurance is automatically included in every MobiRides booking at no additional cost to users. Claims are processed through a streamlined digital system, with most claims resolved within 48 hours.

'We're excited to partner with MobiRides to support the growing sharing economy in Botswana,' said John Serame, CEO of Botswana Insurance Company. 'Their innovative approach to transportation aligns with our commitment to providing accessible insurance solutions.'

The partnerships also include educational initiatives to help users understand their coverage and promote safe driving practices. MobiRides will launch a series of safety workshops and digital resources in partnership with the insurance companies.

Since implementing the enhanced insurance coverage, MobiRides has seen:
- 40% increase in new user registrations
- 25% increase in vehicle owner sign-ups
- 99.8% claim satisfaction rating
- Reduced average claim processing time

'Trust is fundamental to the sharing economy,' added Thabo Mogale, CEO of MobiRides. 'These partnerships reinforce our commitment to creating a safe, reliable platform that benefits everyone in our community.'

The enhanced insurance coverage is now active for all MobiRides users across Botswana. The company plans to extend similar partnerships as it expands into other Southern African markets.
author: MobiRides Communications Team

title: MobiRides Wins 'Best Innovation' Award at Botswana Tech Summit 2023
subtitle: Recognition highlights company's contribution to sustainable transportation solutions
excerpt: MobiRides was honored with the 'Best Innovation' award at the annual Botswana Tech Summit, recognizing its groundbreaking contribution to sustainable transportation in the country.
content:
GABORONE, Botswana - November 15, 2023 - MobiRides was awarded the prestigious 'Best Innovation' award at the 2023 Botswana Tech Summit, recognizing the company's groundbreaking contribution to sustainable transportation solutions in the country.

The award was presented during the summit's closing ceremony, attended by over 500 technology leaders, entrepreneurs, and government officials. MobiRides was selected from over 50 innovative companies across various sectors.

'This recognition validates our team's hard work and our commitment to solving real transportation challenges in Botswana,' said Thabo Mogale, CEO of MobiRides, while accepting the award. 'We're proud to be contributing to the country's digital transformation and sustainable development goals.'

The judging panel, comprised of local and international technology experts, evaluated companies based on innovation, market impact, sustainability, and potential for scalability. MobiRides impressed judges with its comprehensive approach to car sharing and its positive impact on urban mobility.

Key factors that contributed to MobiRides winning the award:
- Innovative technology platform with local market adaptation
- Significant environmental impact through reduced vehicle ownership
- Strong user adoption and community engagement
- Job creation and economic opportunities for car owners
- Comprehensive safety and insurance framework
- Plans for regional expansion

'MobiRides represents the kind of innovation we need to see more of in Botswana,' said Dr. Kealeboga Moruti, Minister of Transport and Communications, who presented the award. 'They've identified a local challenge and created a technology solution that benefits the entire community.'

Since its launch, MobiRides has achieved significant environmental impact:
- Reduced CO2 emissions by an estimated 150 tons
- Decreased urban parking demand by 15% in covered areas
- Enabled over 5,000 people to access transportation without owning a car
- Generated over P3 million in additional income for car owners

The company also announced at the summit that it will be launching an electric vehicle pilot program in partnership with the Botswana government, introducing 50 electric vehicles to its platform by mid-2024.

'This award motivates us to continue innovating and expanding our impact,' added Keitumetse Seretse, CTO of MobiRides. 'We're excited about the future of mobility in Botswana and our role in shaping it.'

The Botswana Tech Summit is the country's premier technology conference, bringing together innovators, investors, and policymakers to showcase local technological achievements and discuss the future of digital transformation in Botswana.
author: MobiRides Communications Team
